summary: But Woods didn’t say this. Now, an Instagram post says Woods publicly criticized Vice President Kamala Harris, whose father is Jamaican and whose mother was Indian, as not being authentically Black. We rate the claim that Woods criticized Harris’ accent Pants on Fire!

claim: U.S. Sen. Sherrod Brown voted to “give illegals taxpayer funded stimulus checks, health care, even Social Security."
summary: So, an amendment that barred immigrants in the country illegally from receiving benefits would not be in order. Keyes added that Brown again voted June 26, 2013, on an amendment to an immigration bill that prevented immigrants in the country illegally from receiving Social Security for work done illegally. Brown campaign spokesperson Matt Keyes said Brown voted for a similar amendment from then-Sen. Bob Menendez, D-N.J., the same day as the Sessions amendment reaffirming immigrants in the country illegally cannot receive federal benefits.

claim: Four government agencies donated nearly $900,000 of taxpayer money to Kamala Harris’ presidential campaign.
summary: Although these four government agencies are listed among the top contributors to Harris’ campaign on Open Secrets’ website, it doesn’t mean the agencies themselves donated to her campaign. As of July 29, Open Secrets reported the following contributions to Harris’ campaign from people affiliated with these government agencies: Defense Department: $213,460 Health and Human Services: $203,574 State Department: $197,640 Veterans Affairs: $217,420 Government agencies, including the Defense Department and the Department of Veterans Affairs, are also listed among the top contributors to former President Donald Trump’s presidential campaign on Open Secrets’ website. Under each of these government agencies, Open Secrets’ website says individuals were the source of the political contributions.. On these top contributor pages, Open Secrets further explains why and how it uses donors’ employer and occupation information.

claim: Nine Americans died from a listeria outbreak after Boar’s Head brand meat prioritized hiring “refugees” in Virginia.
summary: We rate the claim that nine Americans died from a listeria outbreak after Boar’s Head brand meat prioritized hiring "refugees" in Virginia False. The listeria outbreak was tied to long-standing health and safety infractions at a Boar’s Head plant in Jarratt, Virginia. A Tent spokesperson  told PolitiFact on Sept. 3 that Boar’s Head is not working with Tent now and has not hired any refugees through its services.

claim: Rep. Elissa Slotkin “voted recently to let illegals vote in U.S. elections.”
summary: It’s already illegal for noncitizens to register and vote under state and federal laws, and a "no" vote on the bill doesn’t change that. "It is already a crime many times over for noncitizens to vote in state and federal elections." Rogers is wrong; Slotkin never voted to allow immigrants in the country illegally to vote in U.S. elections.

claim: California S.B. 1174 eliminates the requirement for voter ID at polling places.
summary: Senate Bill 1174 prohibits local governments from requiring voter ID at polling places, but existing state law already says that, in most cases, California voters needn’t show ID before voting at the polls. 1174 prohibits local governments from requiring voter ID at polling places, but existing state law already says that in most cases, California voters don’t need to show ID before voting at the polls. By state law, however, California voters need to show ID to polling place workers only if they are voting for the first time after registering to vote by mail and did not provide a valid form of ID on their registration form, a California secretary of state spokesperson said in an email.

claim: President Joe Biden “did a campaign ad at the graves in Arlington in 2020.”
summary: An X post said that Biden "did a campaign ad at the graves in Arlington in 2020." Biden shared a 2020 campaign ad that included a photo taken at Arlington National Cemetery, but it was taken in 2010 as part of his vice presidential duties, not as part of a campaign activity. "Joe Biden literally did a campaign ad at the graves in Arlington in 2020."

claim: Video shows “Kamala Harris describing how she can ruin lives with the 'swipe of a pen.’"
summary: We rate the claim that this video shows Harris describing ruining lives with her pen False. But a viral video appears to show her speaking boastfully about how she could ruin lives as a prosecutor. "Power hungry Kamala Harris describing how she can ruin lives with the 'swipe of a pen,’" an Aug. 16 X post said.

claim: Kamala Harris’ “plan to tax unrecognized Capital Gains mean(s) if your house goes up in value you will have to pay that Tax Even if you don’t sell your House!”
summary: Some economists said an unrealized capital gains tax would promote more equity in the tax code. Most crucially: Most Americans wouldn’t have to pay a tax on the appreciated value of their unsold assets and this tax would apply only to people with more than $100 million in wealth. Social media posts claimed Harris’ "plan to tax unrecognized Capital Gains mean(s) if your house goes up in value you will have to pay that Tax Even if you don’t sell your House."

claim: “There’s no such thing as menopause.”
summary: Numerous clinics, groups of health care professionals and medical research organizations say menopause exists, and generally define it as the point at which a woman has naturally gone 12 months without a menstrual period. Cleveland Clinic: "Menopause is a point in time when a person has gone 12 consecutive months without a menstrual period. Menopause is a natural part of aging and marks the end of your reproductive years."

claim: “Hollywood actor Kurt Russell just said: ‘It is now proven, beyond a shadow of a doubt that Kamala Harris and Joe Biden CHEATED in the 2020 election with mail-in ballots.’”
summary: Former Arizona congressional candidate Josh Barnett shared a post on Instagram that attributed a quote to Russell claiming "beyond a shadow of a doubt" that President Joe Biden’s 2020 election win was fraudulent. We rate the claim that Russell said Harris and Biden "cheated" in the 2020 election False. The post, which is a screenshot of a post on X, read: "Hollywood Actor Kurt Russell just said: ‘It is now proven, beyond a shadow of a doubt that Kamala Harris and Joe Biden CHEATED in the 2020 election with mail-in ballots.’" Barnett captioned the post, "Fact check: TRUE."

claim: Former President Donald Trump "intends to enact what, in effect, is a national sales tax ... that would raise prices on middle-class families by almost $4,000 a year."
summary: Harris said Trump "intends to enact what, in effect, is a national sales tax — call it a Trump tax — that would raise prices on middle-class families by almost $4,000 a year." Even as Trump proposes tax cuts that would benefit wealthier Americans, Harris said, he "intends to enact what, in effect, is a national sales tax — call it a Trump tax — that would raise prices on middle-class families by almost $4,000 a year." Trump has proposed a 10% tariff (and at least once said up to 20%) on all nondomestic goods sold in the U.S., along with a 60% tariff on Chinese goods.

claim: “Kurt Russell forms a new non-woke actors alliance with Roseanne Barr and Tim Allen.”
summary: "Kurt Russell forms a new non-woke actors alliance with Roseanne Barr and Tim Allen," an Aug. 27 Facebook post said. But these actors didn’t form a "non-woke actors alliance," as a recent Facebook post claims. This post was flagged as part of Meta’s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed.

claim: Photo of former President Donald Trump after an assassination attempt was generated by artificial intelligence.
summary: Vucci’s image was authentic and the moment was widely observed. In the altered image, Trump appears to have six fingers. But these posts claiming it wasn’t a real photo include an altered version of the real image as proof.

claim: C-SPAN captions for a JD Vance speech said, “Single person clapping.”
summary: LMAO @cspan caption person for the win pic.twitter.com/QHDFYuXplu But C-SPAN aired no such caption, Robin Newton, a spokesperson for the network said. We rate claims that C-SPAN aired the caption "single person clapping" False. a third said.

claim: “JD Vance actually sent a letter last year to the Department of Justice saying, ‘enforce the Comstock Act.’”
summary: In January 2023, Vance joined about 40 congressional Republicans in sending a letter urging the U.S. Justice Department to enforce the Comstock Act to crack down on mailing abortion pills, which are used in the majority of U.S. abortions. Warren said Vance sent a letter to the Justice Department asking it to enforce the Comstock Act. The letter Vance signed was in response to the release of a Justice Department memo saying U.S. law doesn’t prohibit the mailing of abortion medication as long as the sender doesn’t intend for the medication to be used illegally.

claim: El director general de la Organización Mundial de la Salud "dice que ya no es emergencia sanitaria la viruela del mono" en 2024.
summary: El director general de la OMS anunció una nueva emergencia de salud pública de importancia internacional en 2024 Un vocero de la OMS le confirmó a PolitiFact que el director general de la OMS declaró el aumento de casos de mpox como una emergencia de salud pública de importancia internacional en agosto de 2024. Tedros declaró la emergencia debido a la rápida propagación de casos de la mpox en el este de la República Democrática del Congo, la detección de la enfermedad en países vecinos, y por la posibilidad de una mayor propagación dentro y fuera de África. El video en Instagram es de mayo de 2023, cuando Tedros anunció el fin de la emergencia de salud pública internacional del mpox declarada en el 2022.

claim: El Dr. Juan Rivera lanza "una pastilla revolucionaria" para curar la diabetes.
summary: La biografía de la página en Facebook que comparte la publicación contiene un enlace a Google Play, la tienda en línea de aplicaciones de Google. La gerente de la práctica del Dr. Rivera confirmó a PolitiFact que la publicación no es verídica. La diabetes es una enfermedad crónica "que afecta la forma en que el cuerpo convierte los alimentos en energía", según la página web de los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades (CDC, por sus siglas en inglés).

claim: Image shows Fox Business graphic titled “Tim Walz’s Communist Agenda.”
summary: We rate the claim that this image shows a Fox Business graphic titled "Tim Walz’s Communist Agenda" False. A social media post shared a graphic that appeared to come from Fox Business, highlighting items in Minnesota Gov. The Aug. 7 episode of "Mornings with Maria Bartiromo" did include a graphic titled "Tim Walz’s Economic Scorecard," that looked similar to the altered one.

claim: The proposal to put golf courses, hotels in Florida state parks “was something that was leaked. … a lot of that stuff was half-baked and was not ready for prime time.”
summary: The Florida Department of State sent a notification Aug. 20 announcing plans to hold Aug. 27 public meetings about the proposed plans across the state. The department canceled the public meetings and withdrew the plans for golf courses at Jonathan Dickinson State Park. DeSantis said the environmental protection agency’s proposal to put golf courses, hotels in Florida state parks "was something that was leaked.

claim: “This month alone, more than 16,000 non-citizens have been removed from the voter rolls in 3 states.”
summary: Greg Abbott said Aug. 26 that the state removed about 1 million ineligible people from the voter rolls since 2021. We don’t know how many of the potential noncitizen voters cast ballots; Texas said 1,930 had a Texas voter history. State election officials routinely take steps to remove ineligible people from the voter rolls in accordance with federal law.

claim: Un video muestra un helicóptero distribuyendo “mosquitos genéticos en Massachusetts, Estados Unidos”.
summary: Los usuarios en redes sociales que compartieron el video en 2023 lo relacionaron con un programa de Oxitec de mosquitos modificados genéticamente. El Proyecto de Recuperación de Aves del Bosque de Maui, en Hawai, libera mosquitos infectados con Wolbachia en zonas forestales elevadas. "Massachusetts no participa en ninguno de los trabajos de Oxitec, y no tenemos conocimiento de ningún proyecto en el que se liberen mosquitos", dijo Scales.

claim: Video shows a CNN segment about “veterans cancelling their auto insurance.”
summary: The video in the Aug. 18 Facebook post features CNN’s logo and a "breaking news" chyron that says: "Veterans are cancelling their auto insurance and doing this instead." What looks like a CNN breaking news segment about car insurance for veterans is drawing attention on social media, but maybe not the attention the account posting the video hoped for. "As a veteran, I qualified for the 2024 Veteran & Military Monetary Relief Plan AND apparently you can use it to cut down on your auto insurance," the post said.

claim: Video shows buildings crumbling because of an “earthquake in Taiwan.”
summary: We rate claims that this video shows buildings crumbling because of an earthquake in Taiwan False. The video features dark billowing clouds of debris and buildings crumbling set to an audio track that’s been used in TikTok videos that have been altered to show people, animals and buildings magically materializing in clouds. A recent Facebook post purports to show a series of video clips of the destruction wrought by an "earthquake in Taiwan."

claim: World Economic Forum “document confirms 6 billion humans will die in 2025.”
summary: We found no reputable news organizations or credible information showing that a World Economic Forum document "confirm(ed) 6 billion humans" — or over 70% of the world’s population — will die in 2025. However, the article does not identify or link to any World Economic Forum document that meets that description. A supposed document from the World Economic Forum.

claim: Video shows Jordan Peterson making disparaging remarks about Chinese food
summary: We rate the claim that this video shows Peterson making disparaging remarks about Chinese food  Pants on Fire! A video of Canadian celebrity psychologist Jordan Peterson appears to show him making disparaging remarks about Chinese cuisine. The Facebook video directed viewers to purchase a book promoting herbal tablets.

"Kamala & Walz and Ruben Gallego want to cut your Social Security.

The X post claimed Kirk wrote, "Went to check my phone storage and saw the woke gay agenda is alive and well.

claim: Kamala Harris “wants to forcibly compel doctors and nurses against their will to give chemical castration drugs to young children.”
summary: During Harris’ vice presidency, the Department of Health and Human Services passed a rule that included LGBTQ+ people in the Affordable Care Act’s prohibition on sex discrimination. The change meant that LGBTQ+ people are again included in the Affordable Care Act’s prohibition on sex discrimination. An RNC spokesperson provided information about the Biden-Harris administration’s general support for access to gender affirming care for youth, but did not specify what Trump was referring to or a policy that would "force" doctors to provide care.

claim: “Anything that you lose on the tariff from the perspective of the consumer, you gain in higher wages, so you're ultimately much better off.”
summary: He said some economists say tariffs raise costs for consumers. And higher input costs are also likely to be passed on to consumers, economists said. Our previous review of academic studies of real-world tariffs concluded that consumers ultimately shoulder most of the burden in higher prices for goods, and the burden outweighs tariffs’ economic benefits.

claim: Sen. Bob Casey “voted to sell American oil to China.”
summary: Casey voted against a procedural measure that would have allowed consideration of an amendment to ban exports of oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to China. Casey voted no on a procedural vote about whether to consider an amendment that would have limited foreign exports of oil from the reserve. Casey never participated in a Senate vote that led to the sale of American oil to China.

claim: Rep. Elissa Slotkin’s vote for the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act was a vote to “cut Medicare benefits for seniors.”
summary: Mutual of Omaha said in March that it will exit the Medicare Prescription Drug Plan market at year’s end because of the "pending impact of the Inflation Reduction Act" on Medicare drug plans. Medicare Part D, which offers insurance coverage for prescriptions, is a voluntary program, and about 50 million of the 65 million people Medicare covers are enrolled — either through a standalone Prescription Drug Plan or through Medicare Advantage. The column argued that funding changes under the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act to Medicare Part D — which helps cover prescription drug costs — could lead to higher premiums and fewer benefits for older Americans.
